rows.text: Covers Crook County history, including the City of Prineville Railroad, the local timber industry, and a military exhibit
Web page; information, run by the Curry Historical Society
Museums and organizations encompassed by Antique Powerland Museums
West Lane history in pictures and memorabilia
Website, includes pioneer artifacts, impact of gold mining, the stagecoach and railroads
Website; changing exhibits about architecture and art
Web page; Opened about 1970; still in operation as of 2006
125 foot column tower to climb, scenes of Oregon history on its exterior
National Register of Historic Places listings in Oregon
Web page; Local history and the studio of photographer Maud Baldwin in a four-story 1906 building; run by Klamath County Museums organization
Website; Local history of the area, Native American artifacts, displays on logging, fishing, cranberry farming and the 1936 fire that destroyed the city; maritime room
Web page; displays farm equipment and other artifacts; exhibits on various historical topics; run by the Troutdale Historical Society
Web page; Closed as of May 2008; former home of C. C. Beekman, a prominent Jacksonville banker; run by the Southern Oregon Historical Society
Benton County Historical Society and Museum

Website; County history; now incorporates 60,000-items related to natural history from the former Oregon State University Horner Museum; research library; art gallery; in the 1867 Philomath College building on the National Register of Historic Places
Website; run by the Brooks Historical Society
Website; information, operated by the Polk County Historical Society Farmstead of 1861, period furnishings of 1860-1920; occupied by the pioneer Harrison Brunk family
Website; run by the Lincoln County Historical Society, Victorian period house
Located in Bush's Pasture Park, features two contemporary art galleries
Web page; Built in 1893, restored to depict a beach cottage and rooming house of 1912; run by the Seaside Historical Society
Area history and railroad history, located in a former train depot
Website; life, logging, mining and railroad history in North Santiam Canyon; photographs; research library; Run by North Santiam Historical Society

Website; 1870 home, including a doctor's office, old-fashioned kitchen and pantry; items include antique furniture, medical instruments, Native American baskets, pioneer tools in the wash house and tool shed; a doll museum in the carriage house has two floors of dolls, toys and clothes

Website; Local history including logging, fishing, bulb farming, ranching, Native American artifacts; claims to have the largest Monterey Cypress Tree in Oregon; run by Curry County Historical Society
Web page; Artifacts of railroad history and of Chinese workers; in an original "China House" for Chinese railroad workers
Restored historic aircraft, located at Hillsboro Airport
Columbia River Gorge National Scenic Area
information, information, operated by the Gilliam County Historical Society, includes a settler’s cabin, one-room schoolhouse, train caboose, barbershop, and depot
Website; hand-made clocks, figures of cars, tractors, trains, cameras, miniature pedal cars

Website; formerly part of the Coos-Curry Museum (1958-1970s); then called Coos County Historical Society Museum (until 2004); south Oregon coast history, logging, area Native Americans, ship construction
Information; Lumbering, mining, agriculture, covered bridges, prints, RMS Titanic displays; in an octagon-shaped former church
Website, rocks, minerals, gems, fossils, Native American artifacts
Information; Local history in a restored 1889 Methodist Church
Website; a large classroom in the Historic Springdale School Community Center
Website; Local and regional history; run by the Curry County Historical Society
Exhibits include the area's prehistory, Native American tribes, explorers, pioneers, the logging industry, transportation, home life, and the United States Forest Service
Located in a historic train station, includes railroad period rooms displays, local history, rocks, minerals and mining exhibit
Information, collection of more than 3,000 dolls, including one from 1604
Website; Established in 1892, the -acre (km2) site is said to be Oregon’s oldest working filbert (hazelnut) farm
Douglas County Museum of Natural & Cultural History
Website; Medical equipment and items relating to Junction City history; run by the Junction City Historical Society
Dufur Historical Society Living History Museum
Information; information, living history displays in a historic log cabin, school
Information; Collection includes logging tools, period rooms and farm tools and equipment, photographs
Eastern Oregon Fire Museum & Learning Center
Information; former (1899–2002) fire station; exhibits on history of firefighting; firehouse culture and advances in technology; vintage fire trucks
Website; Has exhibits or artifacts related to logging, mining, cowboy memorabilia, ranching, housewares, period clothing, dolls, toys, a former railroad depot and a former one-room schoolhouse
End of the Oregon Trail Interpretive Center
Website; Presentations by live history Interpreters in pioneer-period clothing
1845 house, the oldest in Clackamas County
Website; Conceptual and contemporary art with emphasis on critical thinking and humor
Website; Western art and Native American artifacts
Military, pioneer and Native American artifacts, Oregon Trail relics, early vehicles, household items, photographs; listed on the National Register of Historic Places
Eight-acre site of Fort Klamath (1863–1890), no original buildings remain; replica of the fort guardhouse contains artifacts from the fort; run by Klamath County Museums organization
Fort Rock Valley Historical Homestead Museum
Original pioneer buildings including a church, school, houses, homestead cabins
Restored fort with living history demonstrations
Website; 1892 farmhouse, 1918 barn, a carriage house and several other buildings
Website, "Remembering Our Roots" exhibit of 1930s fruit-packing and cold-storage plant and equipment; planned Fruit Heritage Museum to open in 2012

Website; Focuses on 18th-century Captain Robert Gray; his historical vessels, the trade with native Americans of the Pacific Northwest; displays include models of his two ships, reproduction of Columbia's figurehead; interactive exhibits; one wing on local history
Website; about area natural, cultural, and historical resources

Web page; Information; Early farm equipment, Union Pacific Railroad caboose, an agricultural-machinery building, 1884 log cabin, 1910 school, 1900 tonsorial parlor, 1905 railroad depot, and early 20th-century jail.
History of Gresham and surrounding area; run by the Gresham Historical Society
Web page; on the National Register of Historic Places; the grounds are part of the city park system; run by the Troutdale Historical Society

Website; scale models of historic buildings, including Crater Lake Lodge; cameras and buttons; antique farm equipment, steam engine, tractors, engines, blacksmith shop and household items; pictures and biographies of settlers; 1867-era house and household items; Overland automobile; a chapel
Website; Calls itself "America's only Hat Museum"; displays a selection of most characteristic styles of past eras; in the Ladd-Reingold House
Exhibits and programs to explain the role of scientific research in marine natural history as well as the fishing industry
Website; also known as Umatilla County Historical Museum, located in a 1909 depot, grounds include a caboose, 1879 one-room schoolhouse, and 1879 homestead with log cabin
Includes live animals and natural history exhibits, pioneer life and seasonal living history 1880 ranch, early 1860s town, Native American exhibits, antique vehicles, trails
I. O. N. Owyhee Heritage Council Museum
Web page; History of an area encompassing parts of Idaho, Oregon and Nevada (the "I.O.N." in the title)
The museum calls its holdings "world's largest and most comprehensive collection of antique carousel art"; as of May 2008, temporarily closed as museum relocates
John Day Fossil Beds National Monument
Includes the Thomas Condon Paleontology Center with fossil exhibits, and the Cant Ranch Museum with exhibits about the cultural heritage of the area
1880 Victorian style farm home; on the National Register of Historic Places; run by the Tigard Historical Association
Chinese culture and heritage in Oregon
Information; information, displays on local history including mining, logging and pioneer history, and Native Americans; on the National Register of Historic Places

Website; includes mechanical banks; trains, planes and automobiles; character toys; police badges; railroad locks, lanterns and related items; early Oregon memorabilia; teddy bears and dolls; and holiday collectibles
Website; History and natural history; in a 1935 building, formerly a National Guard armory; run by Klamath County Museums organization

Website; Oregon Trail exhibit, historic vehicles, period rooms, children's exhibits, early crafts, photographs; run by the Lane County Historical Society in a National Historic Register site that is the oldest building in the county (built 1853)
Website; exhibits on antique and contemporary quilts
Website; Life from pioneer days to the 1940s; in Brownsville's original railroad depot
Web page; Local historical artifacts, seashell collection, and works of local artists and authors
Website; Information; part of the "Oregon Coast History Center" run by the Lincoln County Historical Society

Information; Information; article; The weekly Marshfield Sun (1891–1944) newspaper office and job printing shop displaying printing presses, newspaper and photo-related exhibits of Marshfield (now Coos Bay)
Part of Fort Vancouver National Historic Site, Victorian period home, crafts demonstrations
website; 1865 farmhouse; collection includes 1872 Portland Street Railway Co. horse-drawn streetcar

Former Thomas Kay woolen mill (1889–1962); Jason Lee's Methodist mission to Oregon which settled in the Willamette Valley in 1834; mission houses, Oregon Trail settler's house, historic church and the structures, equipment, and original water-powered turbine of the mill and related artifacts
1849 restored Pioneer Era home; listed on the National Register of Historic Places
Website, includes pioneer, homestead, agricultural and rural history artifacts
Includes natural history dioramas, religious artifacts and Civil War memorabilia
Website; History of Mt. Hood area, encompassing Clackamas, Hood River, Multnomah and Wasco counties, also art and natural history
Web page; Pioneer settlements on French Prairie and the 1839 Catholic mission in St. Paul
History and culture of the Confederated Tribes of Warm Springs
Includes works in ceramic, glass, metal, fiber and wood, showing development of West Coast craft since the mid-20th century
Website, 10K Years of Oregon Culture, Early OR Photography, OR Industry, Historic Oregon City & Willamette Falls
National Historic Oregon Trail Interpretive Center
Website; about north Lincoln County history, including Native Americans and pioneers
Website; Farming, logging, railroading, U.S. Forest Service, schools and families; a caboose, trucks Historical artifacts of the upper Willamette River region
Website; complex includes a museum of local history and a mid-19th century ox barn, cabin, house, summer kitchen and tie shed
Aircraft, artifacts, displays and exhibits on the history of aviation and space exploration; collection includes rare World War II American Eagle aviator uniform and pilot's personal effects
History and information on the 300+ movies that have been filmed in Oregon
Website; Historical fire records, apparatus, equipment and memorabilia

Website; OJM creates and hosts a variety of community-based and traveling exhibitions, provides research access to our library and archives, records oral and filmed histories, presents cultural programs, trains student interns and community volunteers, and engages in educational outreach to promote lifelong learning.
Website; lives and contributions of Oregon's Nikkei community, located in Portland's old Japantown area

he state's official military history repository; has military arms and ordnance, restored military vehicles and aircraft, uniforms and insignia, and military equipment, historic structures, and a library and archives
Oregon Museum of Science and Industry
Vintage railroad equipment, including steam and diesel locomotives and passenger coaches
Closed temporarily, as of May 2008, according to its website
Tours of the building, exhibits of art, minerals
Website; rocks and crystals, local history exhibits, the restored Adler House, antique automobiles
website, 1859 courthouse with sheriff's office and three jail cells
Pacific Northwest College of Art Galleries
Campus includes twelve public exhibition galleries, two professional galleries and ten spaces reserved for student and community showings
Pendleton Round-Up and Happy Canyon Hall of Fame
Currently under construction, cowboy and cowgirl memorabilia, Native American regalia, championship saddles, historical photographs and documents
Website, operated by the South Umpqua Historical Society, pioneer and Native American artifacts
Web page; run by the Junction City Historical Society, 1870s period home with Danish settler artifacts, also adjacent jail
22 room French Renaissance estate situated on acres (m2)
Website; Photographs, equipment, uniforms, and documents; run by the Portland Police Historical Society.
Displays about the lifeboat station, in a 1934 building closed in 1970; hiking trails; listed on the National Register of Historic Places

information, replicas of Alexander Graham Bell's original telephone, photographs, telephones and equipment dating from the beginning of the past century. 112 E. 10th Ave, open Thursdays 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.
Rice Northwest Museum of Rocks and Minerals
Claims to have the "largest opal-filled thunderegg in the world", large pieces of crystallized gold, meteorites, dinosaur eggs and fossils
Website; Natural history and history of the Rogue River; run by a for-profit boat excursion company; free admission
1850 period house operated by the Wasco County Historical Society
Oldest American home in Oregon City, Information
Website; run by the Sandy Historical Society
Web page; run by the Josephine County Historical Society
Website, includes Native American and pioneer artifacts, antique household items and furnishings
Information; Pioneer living-history exhibits, weaving, old photos, farm implements
Information, Memorabilia from the area, including clothing, farm implements and household goods; in the original 1890s West Scio railroad depot
Website; Local history and Native American artifacts
Website; includes farm machinery, tools, household items, memorabilia from Sherman County’s early settlers, Native American items
Information; Museum and living history site in two historical buildings; train exhibit
Information; Silverton area history; in the 1908 Ames/Warnock House
Website, Siuslaw River and its pioneers; logging, agriculture, blacksmithing, and transportation; Native American artifacts
South Benton Communities Historical Association Museum
Information, photos, artifacts from 1850s to present; 1920s Metzker map of original donation land claims, campaign buttons; pictures and history of more than 200 veterans from World War II to present
Information; Collection includes pioneer items, photographs, and farm implements
Website; in the 1911 Oregon Power Company transformer station, listed on the National Register of Historic Places.
Website; 1908 period home with original furnishings, oddities, personal belongings, and kitchen utensils of one of the Oregon Territory's earliest families. Guided tours.
Website; history and natural history of the Sumpter Valley, in the former "Sumpter Supply" building, an 1899 structure that survived the 1917 town fire
Website; North Oregon coastal history and natural history are combined in the former courthouse in downtown Tillamook. Founded in 1935.
Located in a WW II blimp hangar, includes over 30 War Birds and memorabilia
Information; logging, railroad and settlement history of the Toledo area, located at Toledo City Hall, operated by the Lincoln County Historical Society
Information; Artifacts and pictures from the Upper Rogue; in a former tavern

Website; Museum run by area teachers that can be moved from location to location in its cargo trailer; has a model covered wagon, canvas lodging tent, historical artifacts, oral histories, late-19th-century photographs
Umpqua River Lighthouse and Coastal History Museum
History of the lighthouse, area Coast Guard history and local history; in a working lighthouse and adjacent former Coast Guard Station
University of Oregon Museum of Natural and Cultural History
Website; fire-fighting equipment from 1879 to 1963; hand-pulled, horse-drawn, and motorized fire engines; fire fighting memorabilia and photos; run by Clatsop County Historical Society
Web page; Collection of 300 items includes the two-person-operated Busy-Bee (one person pumps, the other vacuums); operated by Stark's Vacuum Cleaner Sales & Service
Artifacts of local history and Native American artifacts
Information; In a 1941 building constructed by the Civilian Conservation Corps and used as an internment camp for World War II conscientious objectors
Wallowa Band Nez Perce Trail Interpretive Center
Web page; run by the Scappoose Historical Society

Website; about the Wells Fargo Company in Oregon history; has a 19th-century stagecoach, an interactive telegraph, a life-size reproduction of a turn-of-the-20th-century bank, and a treasure box used to carry gold long distances.
Focus on aircraft from 1903–1941, also light WWII Army, Army Air Corps, and naval aircraft, antique automobiles, military vehicles, aircraft engines.Website
Forest industry, importance and natural history of forests

Website; also known as the Yamhill Museum, includes tools, carriages, doctor’s and dentist’s equipment, an early school room, a pioneer bedroom, early 20th century parlor, dolls, Yamhill County memorabilia, quilts, textiles, Native American baskets and tools
Lighthouse and period keeper's quarters rooms
Website; Railroad and logging "Heritage Square"; static display of 1922 Baldwin Steam engine, 1923 railway Post Office car, 1907 caboose
Website; Paintings by artists inspired by the land and people of the Yaquina River watershed
